title: As a BOC Admin, I want to see a Non-Roster Invitee flag on Pro Player Profiles
custom_steps:
AC:

* There will be a new â€˜Non-Roster Inviteeâ€™ checkbox in the Baseball Info section of Pro Player Profiles
* Both BOC and Clubs will be able to edit this checkbox (with Admin permissions).
** Clubs will only be able to edit the checkbox for their own players
* Clubs can view this flag on other Clubs' players
* This will be a manual checkbox and not connect to any other widgets or reports (at this time)
** Users will like to be able to query on this flag and will eventually like a NRI report (For 2024)

Future Stories:

title: As a player receiving a Whatsapp or SMS message from EBIS I want to view the message
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a player memo is sent, EBIS will send the memo to all players via Whatsapp or SMS message using the MLB Official Contact Info
* The player will receive a message with the following text:
** Whatsapp: Hi <player first name>, You have received an important communication from the Major League Baseball Office of the Commissioner.  Click â€œView Messageâ€� below to open your message.  
*** There will be a view message button at the bottom
** SMS: Hi <player first name>, You have received an important communication from the Major League Baseball Office of the Commissioner.  Please to go to <message URL> to view your message.
* Clicking to view the message will open up the message in a browser.  The message will display the subject, any text, and any attachments.

Sample URL generated:  [https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebis2-global-services/playermemo/197f9ff8dee1dc953e814b618c7d091b|https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebis2-global-services/playermemo/197f9ff8dee1dc953e814b618c7d091b]

title: As a MNC Admin, I want to be warned when Accepting Terms if the player has another submitted MNC
custom_steps:
AC:

* When accepting terms on a MNC, the system will perform a check to see if the player has any other MNCs in submitted state
* If another submitted MNC is found, the system will return a warning to the user:
** Title: Warning
** Body: This player has another Minor League UPC in submitted stated.  Do you wish to continue?
** Buttons: Continue, Back
* Clicking Continue will continue with the accepting of terms flow.
* Clicking Back will cancel the action

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the Partner League Portal to consume PL roster change information through an API
custom_preconds: Each night, the partner league portal will consume roster change information via API from the partner leagues
custom_steps: Only Pioneer and Frontier League at this time
custom_expected:
AND If a player is removed from a roster, the corresponding tx / history item will be created
AND If a player is added to a roster, the corresponding tx / history item will be created
AND If a player is removed from a roster and added to a new roster, the corresponding tx / history items will be created
AND Players current club will be updated
AND All updates and history entries will also be reflected in the appropriate places in ebis
AND Namely PL Request widget and Player Profiles
AND If there are any errors, they will each be reported as an item in a list named errors

title: As an EBIS User, I want the Quick Search type selection to be sticky
custom_steps:
Currently,  every time a page loads in EBIS, the Quick Search type loads as a Professional Player.  Even if you had performed a search for a different type of person.

AC:

* The Quick Search type will be sticky, during the users session
* If you search for an employee (or other type of person) and then navigate to that profile, the search type will be retained
* If the user logs out, the next time they log in, the search type will return to the default (pro player search)

title: As a BOC MNC Admin, I want to see each Club's Salary Structures
custom_steps:
AC:

* When BOC Users are viewing the Addendum C tab of the Minor Contracts dashboard, they currently see the Addendum C widget and a Salary Structure widget
** The Salary Structure widget currently only shows ARI for BOC
* When the user changes Orgs using the header filter in the Add C widget, the Salary Structure widget will refresh to reflect the structures of the selected Org
* The two widgets will stay in sync and always show data related to the same Org
* If All Orgs is selected in the Add C widget, the Salary Structures widget will display all saved structures from all orgs
** An Org column will be added for the BOC users only
** Club users will not see the Org column

title: As a BOC R4 draft admin I want to be able to change a selected player's school or school class in the draft selection widget
custom_steps:
BOC Rule 4 draft admin users will be able to change a selected players school and school class on the BOC draft day screen in selection listing.  This will work in the same manner as the POS column with a pencil to edit and a check/cancel icon to either update or revert the change.

AC:

* There is a pencil icon next to school name and school class in the â€œDraft Selectionsâ€� listing on the BOC draft day screen
* Clicking the icon puts the field into edit mode
** School is a text box with an auto complete
** School class is a drop down with all possible school classes (this will not be restricted to the matching school type)
* Clicking the green check mark will update the playerâ€™s school or school class if it has been changed in the draft results
* Clicking the red cancel icon will cancel the update and return the field to its original value
* If the draft is in MOCK MODE then nothing else will happen
* If the draft is NOT in mock mode the playerâ€™s school and/or school class will be updated on their profile
* If the school is changed to a different school type then school class will become editable and blanked out upon saving the school.  The cancel button will not return the field to view mode until a selection is made
* City, state and country will be updated appropriately to match the school
** If â€œNo Schoolâ€� is selected, the playerâ€™s home country will be displayed for country
** If the cancel option is selected after updating school then city, state, and country will be reverted to their previous values

title: As a system admin I want the ebis constants screen to display a roster limit section
custom_steps:
AC:

* The new ebis constants page will have an additional accordion above the actual constants titled â€œRoster Limitsâ€�
* The new section will have the following values:
** Major League active upper limit (pre roster expansion)
** Major League active upper limit (post roster expansion)
** Major League active lower limit (pre roster expansion)
** Major League active lower limit (post roster expansion)
** Major League pitcher limit (pre roster expansion)
** Major League pitcher limit (post roster expansion)
** Domestic reserve count limit (in season)
** Domestic reserve count limit (off season)
* Pitcher limit will be removed from the system values page
* all roster count limit checks will be updated to use these new values

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to allow Club users to enter overdue IL Recerts

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to send a reminder email about AAs and Cash Consideration payments
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a BOC TX Admin User is viewing the Transaction Payments screen, there will be an â€œEmail Reminderâ€� button in the footer of the table, next to the Export button
* Clicking the button will send an email to members of the selected Org that are set up to receive â€œAAs & Cash Consideration Remindersâ€� on the Email Utility (previous story)
** Only members of the selected org will be emailed, there is no Email All Orgs option
* The email will be formatted as follows:
** *Subject:* Missing Assignment Agreements & Proof of Payments
** *Body:* Below is a list of all the Transactions missing Assignment Agreements, Proof of Payments, or both. Please upload the missing documents to each individual Transactionâ€™s page in EBIS.
* The body of the email will contain two sections:
** *Assignment Agreements*
*** This section will contain a list of all outstanding AA for the Org
*** Each line will follow this example format:
**** Gudino, Yeltsin E (BAL): Outright (Trade) â€“ 3/28/2019
**** Date is the transaction date
** *Proof of Payment*
*** This section will contain a list of all past due payments for the Org
*** Each line will follow this example format:
**** Santiago, Wilbis (BAL): Rule 5 Selection -12/12/2019
**** Date is the transaction date

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to see a new "AA & Cash Consideration Reminders" section on the Emails utility
custom_steps:
AC:

* On the the transactions section of the Emails utility, there will be a new â€œAAs & Cash Consideration Remindersâ€� section
* In the Notification table, this new section will appear at the bottom

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the duplicate SSN error updated to include the matching profile info
custom_steps:
Business Value:  Currently, when a duplicate SSN is found, the returning error only states that a duplicate was found.  We then need to manually find the match.

AC:

* When the system returns an error stating that a duplicate SSN is found and prevents the user from continuing, the message should include a hyperlink to the duplicate profile.
* Clicking the link will take the user to the duplicate profile.

title: As an EBIS Admin, I want to merge an employee profile into a player profile
custom_steps:
Business Need: Duplicate SSN checks are revealing many employee profiles that were created instead of converting the player profile into an employee profile.  This new feature will make resolving these duplicates a less cumbersome process.

AC:

* There will be a new â€œbatchâ€� on the General section of the batch screen
* This will be called â€œEmployee/Player Mergeâ€�
* Clicking the link will open the merge screen
* There will be an input for the playerID and an imput for the employeeID
* Clicking merge will run a stored procedure that moves all the employeeâ€™s contracts and transactions onto the player profile, and convert the player profile into an employee profile
* The duplicate employee profile will no longer be available

title: As a BOC Admin, I want a new Employees filter added to the BOC Pending Approvals clipboard
custom_steps:
AC:

* There will be a new â€˜Employeesâ€™ filter added to the filter section of the BOCs Pending Approvals clipboard
* This dropdown will contain MJ EE tx, MN EE tx, and UEC:

** Remove Employee from Org (MJ)
** Assign/Reassign Employee (MN)
** Remove Employee from Org (MN)
** Employee Contracts
* Applying these filters will adjust the population of the Pending Approvals widget below
* If the Employees â€˜Allâ€™ checkbox is checked, all employee items will be returned in the Pending Approvals widget
* The Employee option will be removed from the MJ Tx, MN Tx, and Contracts filters
** They will no longer be included with the respective â€˜Allâ€™ checkboxes are checked

title: As a system admin I want a screen to display and edit the ebis constants
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing the left nav
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an EBIS CONSTANTS sub tab under the systems tab 
AND two new permissions will be created; EBIS-CONSTANTS-EDITOR and EBIS-CONSTANTS-VIEWER
AND only users with one of these permissions will see the screen
AND the screen will contain a form listing all ebis constants
AND Values will be either integer, text, or date depending on the constant type
AND form look and feel will be similar to system values (note there is no year value, there is only one accordion System Constants, and there are no subgroupings)
AND there will be an edit button for users who are editors (form starts disabled)
AND when in edit mode, there is a save button
AND clicking save stores any updated values and returns the page to view mode

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to see a new 'Not Met" checkbox for Conditional Cash on outright trade transactions
custom_steps:
AC:

* On Outright Trade transactions, there will be a new column added to the Conditional Cash section
* This column will be titled â€œNot Metâ€�
* There will be a checkbox in each row of the conditional cash section
* All Not Met checkboxes will be checked by default
** As mentioned in another story, this will prompt â€œYes - Not Metâ€� to display on the Transaction Payments tracker
* This field will follow will not be editable by club users in any state
* The field will be continue to be editable by the BOC after the trade is submitted
* When the box is unchecked, this will prompt a change to either â€œYes -Outstandingâ€� or â€œYes - Paidâ€� on the Transaction Payment tracer (covered in previous story)

title: AS a BOC Admin, I want to see a new Conditional Cash column on the Transaction Payment Tracker
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing the transactions payment widget
custom_expected:
THEN There will be a new conditional Cash column added to the Transaction Payment tracker
AND The new column will appear between PTBNL AA and Payment Due
AND possible values for the new column include:
** Blank
*** If there is no Conditional Cash included on the outright trade, the row will be blank in this column
** Yes - Outstanding
*** If the new Not Met check box on the trade has been unchecked, but the Paid On date has not been entered, this value will display
*** If Yes - Outstanding is displayed, the Payment Due column will be populated
** Yes- Paid
*** If the Paid On date on the outright trade has been populated, this value will display
** Yes - Not Met
*** There will be a new Not Met check box (story to follow) on outright trade transactions, if this box is checked, Yes - Not Met will be displayed

* The column will appear between Phone and Address
* This column will display the value entered into the Email field on the respective schoolâ€™s profile

AC:

* Professional players that do not have a certified agent will display a red '!' icon next to the Agent field in their profile header

* Hovering over the icon will reveal a tooltip that displays the following text:
** â€œUncertified Agent - if you wish to negotiate a MJC with this player, contact BOCâ€�

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Intl Ama merging logic updated
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a drug test profile is merged with an unregistered ebis profile, ebis should take the drug test profile as master
* When a drug test proifle is merged with a registered ebis profile, ebis should take the registered profile as master
* When a IPL profile is merged with an ebis profile, ebis should take the IPL player as master
* When two registered ebis profiles are merged, ebis should take the profile with the higher ID as the master

title: As a AMT BOC Admin, I want to delete a check in from a player's history
custom_steps:
Clubs often check in the wrong player and we need to do a data fix to delete the erroneous check in.  Weâ€™d like to give the BOC the ability to delete check ins through the UI.

AC:

* When a BOC AMT Admin is viewing a playerâ€™s Check In History on the playerâ€™s profile, there will be a trash can icon on each row
* The trash can icon will appear to the far right of the table (to the right of Location Comments)
* Clicking the icon will prompt the user to confirm their action:
** Title: Warning
** Body: Are you sure you want to delete this check in?  This is a permanent action and cannot be undone
** Buttons: Continue, Cancel
* Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
* Clicking Continue will delete the check in and re-calculate the playerâ€™s days total for the appropriate club / check in period

title: As a Social Media user I want to see a new social media accordion on the player profile info tab for professional players
custom_steps:
*Wireframe:*[https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=info&g=1|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=info&g=1]

AC:

* If the user has permission to social media monitoring then there will be a new â€˜Social Mediaâ€™ accordion on the player profile info tab for professional players.
* The accordion will contain a list of the player's social media handles followed by a â€œSocial Media Reportsâ€� table listing which contains the following columns:
** Report date - this will be a link to open the actual report in viral nation
** Org
** Safety Score
* For a club user the visible reports should only be those which were requested by the club
* BOC Users will see all reports for the player
* The reports will be sorted by report date with the most recent report at the top

title: As a club user I want to I want to see a Social Media Monitoring widget
custom_steps:
*Wireframe:* [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=social_media_-_club|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=social_media_-_club]

AC:

* Club Users will have the same Social Media Monitoring widget as the BOC ([https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1438|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1438|smart-link])
** It will be in the same location on the Utilities dashboard
* The widget will have all the same functionality as the BOC version of the widget
* The Club widget will not have an Org filter in the header
* The Club widget will ONLY display players currently on the users club who have given consent OR players who's most recent report is for the user's club.
* The club should NOT see any reports requested by a different club and should not see any players listed who do not belong to their club.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to create social media reports for all players
custom_steps:
*Wireframe:* [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=create_report_-_all_players|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=create_report_-_all_players]

AC:

* In the footer of the Social Media Monitoring widget, there will be a Create Report button.  Clicking the Create Report button will reveal a â€œAll Playersâ€� option
** All Players is defined as all players who have given consent.  It does not include players who are â€œMissing Consent,' â€˜Refused,â€™ or 'Not In Org.â€�
* Clicking the â€˜All Playersâ€™ option will prompt the user to confirm that they want to create reports for all players.
* When the action is confirmed the system will generate a report for each player currently in the list who has given consent.
** Players included on the widget only because they have an existing report do *NOT* get a new request.
* Newly created reports are considered â€œPendingâ€� 



Additional Info:

Reports generated will be stored in the new social media report table, linking the returned viral nation report id to the new request ([https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|smart-link])

title: As a BOC user I want to be create social media reports for all first year players
custom_steps:
*Wireframe:* [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=create_report_-_all_1st_year_players|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=create_report_-_all_1st_year_players]

AC:

* In the footer of the Social Media Monitoring widget, there will be a Create Report button.  Clicking the Create Report button will reveal a â€œAll 1st Yearâ€� option
** First year players are defined as anyone on a 1st Year Domestic or International contract where the current calendar year is equal to or greater than the start year of their contract
** If the player was included in a previous year as a SFNY player, they should be omitted
* Clicking the â€œAll 1st Yearâ€� option will prompt the user to confirm they want to create new social media reports for all first year players
* When the action is confirmed the system will generate a report for each first year player currently in the list who has given consent.
** Players included on the widget only because they have an existing report do *NOT* get a new request.  
* Newly created reports will be considered â€œpendingâ€�



Additional Info:

Reports generated will be stored in the new social media report table, linking the returned viral nation report id to the new request ([https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|smart-link])

title: As a BOC user I want to create a new social media report for a player from the Social Media Monitoring widget
custom_steps:
*Wireframe:* [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=create_report_-_individual_player|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=create_report_-_individual_player]

AC:

* On the social media monitoring widget, there will be a button on each row for players who have given consent to create a new social media report for that player.  
** If the player has not given consent and is only on the widget, â€˜Missing Consentâ€™ will display.
** If the player has refused consent and is only on the widget, â€œRefused' will display,
** If the player has had a report completed, but is no longer with the Org, â€˜Not on Orgâ€™ will display. 
* Clicking on the button will first prompt the user for confirmation that they want to request a report for the specified player.  Upon confirming the system will send a request to create a new report for the player to Viral Nation.
* The group id on the report should be set to the org who requested the report (the players current org) 

Additional Info:

The report request will be stored into the new social media report table, linking the returned viral nation report id to the new request ([https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|smart-link])

title: As a BOC Social Media user I want to see a Social Media Monitoring widget
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=social_media_-_boc|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=social_media_-_boc]

AC: 

* There will be a new Social Media tab on the Utilities dashboard 
** The tabs should be reordered to appear in alpha order 
* Opening the Social Media tab will load the Social Media Monitoring widget 
** The widget layout will match the provided wire 
* The widget population will be all players who are on an org and have currently have consented to allow social media monitoring as well as any player who in the past has had a social media report even if they no longer have given consent to allow monitoring.  

The widget will display the following columns: 

* Player Name (Last, Roster First) 
* Org 
** this will be the playerâ€™s current org OR the org that they were on for their most recent requested social media report, if they currently have not given consent to monitoring, but did in the past 
* 1st Yr 
** Will display a green check if the player is a first year player - {{First year players are defined as anyone on a 1st Year Domestic or International contract where the current calendar year is equal to or less than the start year of their contract}}
* Most Recent Report 
** The report date with a link to the playerâ€™s most recently created social media report 
* Safety Score 
** The playerâ€™s most recent reportâ€™s safety score 
* Pending Report 
** Creation date of any reports that are pending and not yet complete 
* There will be a column where users can create reports for individual players ([https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1440|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1440|smart-link|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1440|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1440|smart-link|smart-link]) 
** The create button may not be available for all players
* There will be a Create Report button in the footer. Clicking the button will reveal additional options: 
**  All Players - create reports for all players (functionality described in [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1442|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1442|smart-link|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1442|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1442|smart-link|smart-link]) 
** All 1st Year - create reports for all first year players (functionality described in [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1441|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1441|smart-link|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1441|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1441|smart-link|smart-link]) 



Additional Info: A new table will need to be created to store social media reports ([https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|smart-link|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1439|smart-link|smart-link]) which will drive the last two columns.

title: As a developer I want to enhance the social media batch for upcoming viral nation updates
custom_steps:
Weâ€™re going to be changing how the viral nation social media reports are created and handled by pushing a lot of the logic into ebis.  In order to facilitate the upcoming changes we need to update the existing social media batch.  It is currently processing all players with consent and storing their social media information into a table with a json object and nothing more.

It will now:

* Store the social media info on a per player, per account basis in a new assoc table.  (cols; player_id, account_link, account type, handle, created/updated cols)
* Call viral nation to create/update the player with there social media accounts (create if no VN id exists already, update if the id does exist)
* Store the playerâ€™s VN id in a new column in pro_player (if newly created in prior step

Weâ€™re going to need one new table (the assoc to accounts) and a new column in pro player (Viral Nation id)

title: As a System Admin, I want users told when they need to reset their Inside Password
custom_steps:
Use Case:
 - When BOC users reset their password, ebis may not be able to log them into BO.  When this happens, they should informed on how to remedy the situation.

AC:
 - If when trying to print or access the reporting menu (or anywhere else BO is called), the system responds with a 703 status code on BO login, the following error message should be returned:
 - *Title:*  Error
 - *Body:*  The system is unable to be log you into the reporting engine.  Please access inside.mlb.com and reset your password to match your OKTA password.  Once this is complete, you may try this action again.

Contact ebissupport@mlb.com with any questions."
 - *Buttons:* Back

title: As a BOC User, I want to send a player memo via Text
custom_steps:
AC:
 - When a player memo is sent, EBIS will send the memo to all players via Text using the MLB Official Contact Info
 - Deliveries and failures will be logged and available for download

title: As a BOC User, I want to send a player memo via WhatsApp
custom_steps:
AC:
 - When a player memo is sent, EBIS will send the memo to all players via Whatsapp using the MLB Official Contact Info
 - Deliveries and failures will be logged and available for download
